result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Second appearance on January 10, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Proposed - Motion and Order to Withdraw (Atty Anthony Nehls)
Letter to Court from Atty Nehls dated November 2, 2022 re: adjournment request
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 7, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pretrial Status Report

4:08 PM Defendant BILLIE J RAULS in court.  Attorney Anthony Clarence Nehls in court for BILLIE J RAULS.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Nehls states the prelim will proceed. 

Scott Strahan sworn, direct by ADA McElroy is employed by City of Berlin Police Department as a Sergeant of Patrol. Was employed on the date in question. Testimony given. Identified the defendant present in court. Venue established. Cross exam by Atty Nehls. Re-direct by ADA McElroy. Argument by Atty Nehls. Argument by ADA McElroy. Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony has been committed and that the felony probably was committed by the defendant and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files an information with the court - same as the criminal complaint and copy emailed to Atty Nehls. Attorney Nehls acknowledges receipt of the information and waives any reading. Atty Nehls enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant. 

Court adjourned at 4:33 PM

Court will set for Return Date on October 17, 2022 at 10;30 AM.
Return date scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Return date on October 17, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 26, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

9:07 AM Defendant BILLIE J RAULS in court.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  ADA McElroy makes bond recommendation. Court sets bond at $500 signature bond and conditions of: Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant waives the time limits. Court will set for Status of Counsel on April 19, 2022 at 10:00 AM.

Court adjourned at 9:09 AM.
